title: Is the d orbital bigger than the s orbital? - Quora

response.answer_text: Quora Moderation totally screwed the original question, and I have reverted it to the intended question. The answers below were to what Quora Moderation had produced. Orbital is descriptive of a satellite orbiting a primary, so can be many AU in size. Orbitol is usually sodium monofluorophosphate, and is a smaller molecule than: Sorbitol is C6H14O6. Sub-orbital is smaller than orbital, yes.
